primary_type.title: Primary dither pattern type
primary_type.description: MIRI primary dither pattern type: cycling, Reuleaux, Gaussian, 2-point, 4-point-sets, wfsc, none.

starting_point.title: Starting point in pattern
starting_point.description: MIRI imaging starting point in the dither cycling pattern: 1-311 cycling, 1 Reuleaux, 1 Gaussian, 0 none
starting_point.misc: PPS defines as starting point in the CYCLING pattern and the valuie is set to NULL when the pattern_type is REULEAUX.

total_points.title: Total number of point in pattern
total_points.description: MIRI imaging total number of points in primary dither cycling pattern: 3-311 cycling, 12 Reuleaux, 5 Gaussian, 1 none
total_points.misc: PPS allows for pattern wrap with defined range >3 and will set to NULL when the pattern_type is REULEAUX.

subpixel_number.title: Subpixel sampling pattern number
subpixel_number.description: MIRI imaging subpixel sampling pattern number: 1-4 (1 if SUBPIXEL = F)
subpixel_number.calculation: Determined by SDP tracking exposures within a dither pattern.

pattern_size.title: Primary dither pattern size
pattern_size.description: MIRI imaging primary dither pattern size: small, medium, large, default
pattern_size.misc: PPS includes a DEFAULT value indicating the default offset between points

starting_set.title: Starting 4-point set number
starting_set.description: The user-specified starting set number of the series of 4-point dither sets. 1-10 repeating sets can be executed. Only applies when the 4-POINT-SETS dither pattern type is in use.

number_of_sets.title: Total number of 4-point sets
number_of_sets.description: The total number of 4-point dither sets requested by the user. 1-10 repeating sets can be executed. Only applies when the 4-POINT-SETS dither pattern type is in use.

direction.title: Direction of dither pattern offsets
direction.description: The user-specified direction of dither pattern offsets to use. Can be positive or negative.

optimized_for.title: Dither pattern optimization
optimized_for.description: Identifies the type of science for which the dither is optimized. This field applies only to the 4_POINT_SETS pattern.

sparse_points.title: Sparse cycling dither points
sparse_points.description: The sparse cycling dither pattern allows the observer to specify consecutive positions from the cycling lookup table using a list. The DITHPNTS keyword records the specified list of points, such as “1, 3, 6-10, 23, 29-55”. A NULL value indicates that the exposure did not use the SPARSE_CYCLING dither pattern.
